name: Hard Formula
statement: This is the easy version of the problem. The difference between the versions is that in this version, the limits on $$$n$$$ and the time limit are smaller. You can hack only if you solved all versions of this problem. You are given an integer $$$n$$$, and you need to compute $$$(\sum_{k=1}^n k\bmod\varphi(k))\bmod 2^{32}$$$, where $$$\varphi(k)$$$ equals the number of positive integers no greater than $$$k$$$ that are coprime with $$$k$$$.
inputFormat: The only line contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 10^{10})$$$.
outputFormat: Print a single integer, representing $$$(\sum_{k=1}^n k\bmod\varphi(k))\bmod 2^{32}$$$.
